intro: Ifloga paronychioides, commonly known as the false holly, is a shrub native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are a key feature of its botanical appearance. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in tropical and subtropical regions.
